item.title: Screen shortcuts for split experience
item.description: Most useful shortcuts to operate screen Aside from basic screen shortcuts for moving around, creating and changing windows there are things that create more of a window manager feel for terminal usage. And these are splits. You can create a split with Ctrl-a | - which creates a vertical split. There is also Ctrl-A S to create a horizontal split. To cycle between your open splits just use Ctrl-a <Tab>. To close the active split - just press Ctrl-a X
